page.title: 01TYPICAL RURAL S.CHESHIRE
page.content: This is a rural part of Cheshire,the landscape is beautiful with rolling green fields. A long red sandstone ridge dominates the area, along it runs the Sandstone Trail. It has some pine plantation on the slopes, these and other groups of trees contribute to the varied and interesting views in all directions. Two small villages, a few farmhouses, Bolesworth Castle and a few public houses comprise the buildings.The two villages are called Harthill and Burwardsley. Harthill has a church and Harthill County Primary School, a village school. Burwardsley comprises several houses,a church,a chapel, two workshops and a Post Office/Stores. The roads are narrow and winding, often with high hedgerows. Cattle and wildlife are plentiful.The majority of fields are used as grazing land.
